newsitem.title: USA: RehabCare buys contract therapy company.
newsitem.headline: RehabCare buys contract therapy company.

text.p: RehabCare Group Inc said Wednesday it acquired all of the outstanding shares of Team Rehab Inc and Moore Rehabilitation Services Inc, both privately held providers of therapy services to long term care and outpatient facilities.
In 1996, the companies generated a combined $5.6 million in revenue.
The companies will operate as wholly owned subsidiaries of RehabCare.
Marilyn Moore, founder of the companies, will continue as president, reporting to James Usdan, president and chief executive officer of RehabCare.
"Opportunities for synergies between Team, Moore and RehabCare and their respective client bases are excellent," Usdan said in a statement.

RehabCare provides acute rehabilitation, subacute, outpatient and temporary therapist staffing services on a contract basis in conjunction with over 750 hospitals, nursing homes and contract therapy companies in the United States.
Shares of RehabCare were trading up 1/8 to 19-5/8.
